entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (6)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (6)20130811
I played this morning for about three hours and beat the game. I
played on the highest difficulty allowed when you start. I'd like
to keep going, but I feel like it is really inconvenient, because
I don't want my kids to be around (because of all the violence and
language and butt rock in the game.) I think I will do it
though. The big question is whether I play old school games on the
down time or start my other PS3 game I have.

The final bosses were pretty interesting, although I found Vergil
to not be very difficult once you realized you had to beat him in
Devil mode. I also thought that Mundus wasn't that hard to dodge,
but he did so much damage you could only take a few hits before
going down, which made it feel harder. I think the fight against
the Mundus Spawn was very interesting though.

I was very curious how they were going to have Vergil turn on
you. Given that I've played the other games, I know he's supposed
to be the bad guy, so I was quite surprised at the beginning when
he was kind of your boss.

Game 1: 10:28
Total time: 10:28
  • Video Games
  • DmC: Devil May Cry
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Lords of Thunder (TG-16, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Lords of Thunder (TG-16, 1993)20130811
I played the first level of this in about ten minutes. The concept
of a medieval fantasy shooter is very interesting and the "shop"
at the beginning of each stage where you can buy upgrades is also
pretty cool. But once you get passed that, it's not that much more
interesting then any other old horizontal shooter.

Total time: 0:11

  • Lords of Thunder
  • TG-16
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Rocket Knight Adventures (GEN, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Rocket Knight Adventures (GEN, 1993)20130811
I played this game today and beat it on Hard (with Save States at
each checkpoint, so basically infinite lives). It was pretty
brutal. In Hard, not only do you only start with One Life, but
everything kills you on one hit, so it's like playing a shmup and
doing a 1CC.

I found the general mechanics to be pretty much just okay. Not
terrible, but not spectacular either. However, the "set pieces"
and sequences in the game that were different we really cool. The
"puzzle rooms" in Stage 5 and the forced scrolling chase were
really neat. Stage 6, which was entirely in the shooter style, was
very fun too. It was awesome to take down the ship piece by piece.

It was also cool how even after fighting the final boss, you still
had to dodge and weave as it chased you to Earth. It was a good
tough.

In general, the graphics were some of the best I've seen on the
Genesis and I was genuinely impressed. 

Nevertheless, it feels like a one-off game that I couldn't get a
lot from another time.

Total time: 2:27
  • Video Games
  • Rocket Knight Adventures
  • GEN
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Shining Force 2 (GEN, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Shining Force 2 (GEN, 1993)20130811
I played through the first battle of this and was not
impressed. You could tell that it was trying to be faster paced
than the first one, but there wasn't enough variety and speed up
to really appreciate it enough. I found it sub-par.

entry.title: Game: Vay (Sega CD, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Vay (Sega CD, 1993)20130811
I started this off and played for about ten minutes. The voice
acting was atrocious, but you could appreciate that they were
trying. The graphics are very beautiful, but once I got into
battles, I found it very clunky. It reminds me of a TurboGrafx
game: beautiful, but without the finesse that would seem to go
with something so nice looking.

Total time: 0:09
  • Video Games
  • Vay
  • Sega CD
  • 1993

entry.title: Movie: Olympus Has Fallen, starring Gerard Butler (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Olympus Has Fallen, starring Gerard Butler (2013)20130811
This was a fun movie, but with a lot of flaws. I thought the plot
had a big hole in that I'm high doubtful that any capitulation
would take place and I'm skeptical a plan would get so close to the
White House before F15 shot it down. I thought Butler did a great
job. The action was pretty intense but overall the movie was far
too dark to really appreciate what was going on. I'd say it is a
solid 3 stars.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (5)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (5)20130810
I played for a little less than an hour and did two missions. The
nightclub mission was really trippy and the Order mission was very
different, because you spent so much time in the real world. It
was neat. I like that there are so many enemies around this part
of the game that you have to bounce between Angel/Demon weapons
with.

entry.title: Book: A War Like No Other, by Victor Hanson (2006)
entry.content:
Book: A War Like No Other, by Victor Hanson (2006)20130810
I started reading this book yesterday and I'm enjoying the idea of
being connected between with the Greek world. His first chapter
makes the war seem so tragic in terms of what progress would have
been like without it. Since I just read about the consequences of
the fall of Rome, it's very depressing to imagine how the world
could have been so much further a long without these mistakes.
  • Books
  • 2006

entry.title: Movie: Admission, starring Tina Fey (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Admission, starring Tina Fey (2013)20130810
This was a relatively funny movie. I thought the cast was very good
and Tina Fey was quite funny compared to the others. Overall, I
felt the plot was kind of lame and the big reveal at the end wasn't
too exciting. The actor that played her son was very awkward and
most of the time it worked for his character, but at the end
particularly it just felt like bad acting. I liked the caricature
of the hippy students.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Super Mario Land 3: Wario Land (GB, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Super Mario Land 3: Wario Land (GB, 1993)20130809
I played this for about ten minutes and did the first two
levels. I didn't really like it. The huge Wario sprite makes it
feel very cramped and it seems like the challenge is very minimal,
as he's almost indestructible and the enemies are pretty easy to
avoid relative to his size. Nevertheless, even playing for such a
small period of time, it was fun to observe the quirkiness of the
world with, for instance, onion power-ups.

Total time: 0:07

entry.content:
Book: Medieval Cities: Their Origins and the Revival of Trade, by Henri Pirenne (1925) (3)20130809
I finished this book today. I found the whole thing very
interesting and different from most of what I've read recently. I
liked "re-living" the founding of cities and thinking about the
effect they had on the world.

entry.title: Movie: The Host, based on the work by Stephanie Meyer (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: The Host, based on the work by Stephanie Meyer (2013)20130808
I was generally skeptical about whether this movie would be any
good. I found a lot of the acting a little "eh", but the world was
really cool. It's like a Sci-Fi version of the *REDACTED* doctrine that
Satan (and his followers) have no body, but want one, and can
possess humans and that their goal is for everyone to be "good" but
without the agency to decide to be good. A lot of what goes on in
the movie is clearly deeply inspired by this idea.

Some of the worst parts of the movie are classic Stephanie though:
for instance, the crazy love square with two people in one body,
which is at its craziest when Wanderer kisses two boys within
minutes.

There are some logical problems with the plot that I thought of,
or at least big questions:

- How do the Souls originally start the invasion? We see them enter
bodies by making an incision and then crawling in. It seems like
to start off, they would have to arrive not in "Soul" form but in
other bodies on traditional ships. Yet, we see them only travel
through space in their little Soul capsules.

- If it takes so long to travel between planets, as Wanderer says,
then how is it that there are Souls arriving periodically in the
first place. They would have had to have left long long before
the invasion of Earth started, confident that they would
eventually take it over, and given that the Souls do not appear
to be conscious during their capsule time, how would they steer
to the planet unless they knew already that it was inhabitable
and knew where the landing pad would be?

I like it when a book or movie leaves lots of interesting questions
about its universe. I'm interested in reading the book now.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Avenging Spirit (GB, 1992)
entry.content:
Game: Avenging Spirit (GB, 1992)20130807
I played this for ten minutes and got to the third level. The
Kirby-like system of possessing enemies is very interesting and it
is clear that different enemies are better in different
situations. The platforming is really bad though. I feel like they
tried to compensate for the cramped screen with "floaty" jump
controls that give you much more leniency with where you will
land, but that this was an unwise choice and it is just
annoying. It has the annoying Ninja Gaiden-like enemy respawning
when you scroll their spawn points. Ouch. I can see how this game
is very interesting and worth thinking about, but it definitely
doesn't feel like a classic worth devoting a lot of attention to.

Total time: 0:10
  • Video Games
  • Avenging Spirit
  • GB
  • 1992

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (3)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (3)20130807
Today I played for about 1.5 hours and beat the next big boss
after three missions. I got the Devil Trigger, which is pretty
unique in this game. And I got to another Secret Mission that
pretty much destroyed me. The game is still a lot of fun. I really
liked the style of the fight against the news guy... as he was
narrating the fight and talking to you. Very neat.

Total time: 6:19
  • Video Games
  • DmC: Devil May Cry
  • PS3
